titleStmt.title: Despatch from Beverly Y. Payne to George L. Rives, March 31, 1888

bibl.title: Despatch from Beverly Y. Payne to George L. Rives
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p:
Consulate General of the United States.
Monrovia, Liberia, March 31, 1888.
Mr. B. Y. Payne to the Assistant Secretary of State

I have the honor to respectfully transmit the following as my returns or report since my incumbency October 1887 to date, which consist of Digest of Invoice book (1) of Arrivals and departure of American vessels (2) Summary of Consular business (3) Record of official official
official fees (4), Miscelleneous expenses with vouchers (5) and General account (6)

Permit me to express my deep regret that I have not forwarded these returns in regular order (quarterly): My reason for not doing so, was that Mr. Taylor requested me, not to, until his return, which would have been before the ending of December quarter, last, according to his arrangement, and not until I had entered upon the quarter ending this date did I hear of his resignation, and forwarded my Bond.

I have put no house house
rent in the account, but there is one quarter due Mr Sharp, to date: having no authority to settle same, I have requested him to await until I can get advice in reference to the matter.

I have further to state in explanation of my account rendered, that the bill of Mr R. A. Sherman, is for landing the case Stationary &c consigned to the Legation when Mr Taylor was in charge, which was carried to the Leeward, and landed a few days after Mr Taylor's departure. The Bill of Messers G. Moore & Son, is for sundries which ever necessary to be be
be had for the cleanliness of, and light for safety of the Legation.
The two boys Thomas Roberts, and were left at the Legation by Mr Taylor.
I trust my report will be in order and satisfactory, as Mr. Taylor left the Legation to return in two and a half months, and matters very scattered and awkward.

I have the honor to be
Sir
Your very obedient Servant
Beverly Y Payne.
div1.fw:
Hon.,
George L. Rives,
Ass't Sec'y State
div1.p: Enclosures. Digest of Invoice Book. Arrivals & Departure of vessels. Summary of Consular business Record of official fees. Miscelleneous expense with vouchers & General Acct
